dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: It's snowing in southwestern Ohio. Before us, nestled in rolling hills: a postcard slice of suburbia. SUPER the le

dialogues.text: Three Weeks Earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaceful. Serene. It's the town in the glass bubble, the God shakes to watch it snow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN, dozens of them, bursting from houses. Slapping screen doors. A HORSE-DRIVEN SLEIGH is rattling down Main Street. Flanked by kids. Christmas carols, droning from  loudspeakers. HAPPY, LAUGHING SANTA waves howdy, chortling his "Ho's" i groups of three, meanwhile he's really a grizzled old fir marshall named EARL, freezing his nuts off. Beside him sits MRS. CLAUS, about whom we notice two thin First, she's the June in this June/December pair -- and  second, she's to kill for, an effortlessly beautiful woma For the record, meet SAMANTHA CAINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you holdin' up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezing my nuts off.

dialogues.text: Santa produces a bottle of Seagrams. Starts to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Put that away*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Mrs. Claus is HOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha squirms in her seat, scowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it, Earl, this dumb  costume is giving me a wedgie. Driving  me crazy, but there's these *kids*  here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, half my life's a doctor's  hand up my ass, I should marry the  fucker.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Throughout the following NARRATION, we watch Sam: 1) Rall the varsity CHEERLEADERS; 2) Showing off a GERBIL to her  seventh graders; 3) Kneeling in church with her HUSBAND,  blessing herself; 4) Absently fingering a silver KEY whic she wears round her neck; and finally 5) Probing at a tin ridged SCAR under her hairline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years. I keep hiring detectives,  but they never find anything. (beat) I was born 3000 days ago on the beach  in New Jersey. I entered the world  fully grown, wearing clothes I don't  remember buying. Nothing in the  pockets but a single key, filed  smooth. (beat) I'm married now. Nice guy, early  forties. I stand naked in the mirror  and try to guess my age. Thirty-five,  maybe. I have lots of scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha walks with her husband HAL. Late thirties. Baldi Coming out of St. Paul's Episcopal Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, I gotta tell you, of all the  Christmas pageants I've seen, this  was by far the most recent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, honey, I had teenage girls playing  the wise men, what'd you expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teenage boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought they did fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine? Come on, it was ground  breaking stuff. The first Nativity  where Joseph stares at the wise men's  tits all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him good-naturedly. As they near their house, an eight year-old GIRL drops from a TREEHOUSE and comes runn leaps into Mommy's arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid leaps into her arms, as we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Caitlin. She's my daughter  and when I woke up on that long-ago  day, she was two months grown in my  belly. I don't know who put her there.  I may never. I just know she's mine,  and she's about to turn eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family troops up the driveway to their SUBURBAN HOME. Chipper little A-frame. Christmas lights abound. Behind t house, a vast frozen POND. It is idyllic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARTY in progress. Laughter. Mingling. In the corner, CAI puts pipe cleaner antlers on the gerbil. Samantha shepher her home room class past the punchbowl. She is radiant. E surreptitiously nips from a silver flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3000 days. I teach now, fifth grade.  I have the key, I wear it around my  neck for luck. Except for that, and  my name, all traces of my prior life  are lost. (beat) Was I in love ever...? Did someone  look in my eyes, did I say, "Darling,  I'll never forget you...?" (beat) Because fuck me, darling, I managed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE ROOM -- Her daughter CAITLIN hangs with two yo girls. Shows off a plush TEDDY BEAR, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Mr. Perkins, my Mom named  him for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL #1 points, whispers excitedly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin nods. Kid #2:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Her Mom, she's got amnesia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice interrupts their reverie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls whirl around, startled -- Samantha is leaning o the desk behind them. Busted. She smiles amiably:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, girls. Caitlin, I'm going to  help Dad with the refreshments. (leans in, whispers) Which one's Dad? I forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look at her like she's grown a tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Kidding*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOOR KICKED OPEN, WHAM-! Splintered. Lock shattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NUDE COUPLE on the bed. They look up, startled -- as th men burst through the door. The LEADER: a haggard-looking man sporting a soup-stain on his tie, whoops, that's the  design, sorry. MITCH HENESSEY, private investigator and c man extraordinaire. He flashes a phony badge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE. DON'T MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this...?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me an attitude, sir. You're  assuming I won't shoot your sorry  ass, and everyone knows when you  make an assumption, you make an ass  out of u and mption. I'm Sergeant  Madigan, Vice, and if you cop a 'tude,  jerkoff, I will see to it you spend  the next ten years in prison getting  ass-fucked, and if the case is thrown  out because my arrest is too violent,  then I will personally HIRE men to  ass-fuck you for ten years. So if  you're an ass-fucking fan, go ahead  and mouth off, but meanwhile you're  under arrest for the crime of  prostitution, now shut the fuck up  before I cut out your kneecaps and  use 'em as ashtrays. (beat) Officer Donleavy, read him his rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donleavy looks pale, pasty. He stutters a few words. Lose interest. Wanders away across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a trifle confused) Please, this is my first, I... I've  never done this before, I'll do  anything...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, listen to me. I understand you're  not a wealthy man, but in light of  the damage this arrest will cause  you, we might be able to make an  arrangement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donleavy plops in a chair. Belches. Grins foolishly. The in bed points to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he all right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE REMAINING COP is swaying on his feet. Like a tree in hurricane. Donleavy pukes all over the floor. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE'S THE GIRL. The one in bed moments ago. She and Hen are dividing a wad of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta stop using bums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lights a smoke) Forget it. They looked like cops. We  pulled it off, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want I should hire actors, for  Chrissake? These guys are cheap,  they work for food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. So, when they puke all over  you is that, like, a refund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trin, I'm pissin' myself over here,  you're so funny. What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates an envelope earmarked for him. Labeled in ma marker: SAMANTHA CAINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New case, honest to God chick with  amnesia. You want the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey opens the envelope. Extracts a black and white H SHOT of Samantha, says immediately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Yep, yep, yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares, mesmerized. Trin peers over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't there a lady on TV named  Samantha? Had a magic nose or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bewitched', yeah. Good show. Chick  lived with a faggy guy, then in the  last season it was a different faggy  guy. Okay. Here's what we do; get on  the horn to amnesia chick, tell her  yes. Then tell her in 1967 she  promised to give me a blow job. Worth  a try, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA and HAL bid goodnight to their friends and neigh Hal steers her away from a middle-aged teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, guy's all over you like a  cheap suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, there's a cheap suit  all over him like a cheap suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices EARL sitting in the bushes by the side of the building. He is speaking intently to the gerbil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy. Someone's gotta take my  father home. I'm plowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha takes the keys from him. Breathes deeply of the  chill night air. Smiling. Surveys the scene... their frie The neighborhood. Sighs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At which point, young Caitlin says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know?

dialogues.speaker: STATE PRISON
dialogues.text: Switch gears: A grim, grey building. Guarded. Patrolled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired TV set drones to an audience of one. Let's call h ONE-EYED JACK. In fact, let's give him one eye, the other replaced by a PATCH. He smokes cigarettes, stubs them out the chair's armrest. Throws offhand glances at the TV scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So much for the flame-swallowing   Santa of Boone County. Meanwhile,  KTVA news journeyed to Upper Sandusky,  where Santa's own *Mrs*. Kringle  turned out to celebrate her hubby's  worldwide tour. After one look at  her, I'm thinking Santa got what he  wanted this Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The happy news chatter continues. Jack isn't listening. J isn't talking or breathing either. He's simply STARING at the TV screen, jaw slack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be fuckin' kidding. No. No  way. SHIIIT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had to pick a night to die horribly, you'd be hard pressed to find a nicer one. A country highway. Bathed in moonlight. Crusted with snow. Pontiac Sunbird, wending it way through the wooded slopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA drives while Earl (the SANTA we saw earlier)  reclines, still drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married what now, five  years...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a thumb circle. Jabs his finger in and out of it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Hal, how often you two...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick our fingers in out hands and  pull them out again? Every chance we  get. Shut your piehole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all snippy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl, do me a favor. Every few words  say "hic" and have bubbles come out  your mouth, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, I'm not drunk. Would a  drunk man have this much raw talent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts playing the Hawaiian nose harp. In Sam's ear, s can't help it, snorts laughter -- THE ADULT DEER appears perfectly framed in the Sunbird's  headlights. Dead ahead. Sam looks up, face etched in sudd TERROR. *No time to think*. SWERVES, no dice...! BROADSID the animal -- And it comes THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD. All two hundred and  fifteen pounds of it. Fucks up their night altogether.  Actually, it only makes it *halfway* through -- But the damn thing is ALIVE. More than alive. KICKING.  Thrashing. Squawling with pain and rage. A FLAILING HOOF  takes out Earl. Kills him in less than a second. Collapse his skull. Sam rides the wheel, screaming. An antler gouges her ches Rips. Draws blood. She SWERVES, madly -- Hits the tree do 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam goes airborne. Explodes through the windshield, outwa bound. Shower of glass, spritz of blood... And then she's flying. Slow motion, end over end... We lose all SOUND.  Silence as she tumbles. Below and behind her, the Sunbird noiselessly ERUPTS. Fireball, sky high -- Sam floating. Describes a lazy arc in mid-air... Whoomph- Disappears into the snow. Swallows her, leaves a silhouet Around her, trees catch fire. Burn. She lies in her impro sarcophagus. Out of sight. THE FLAMING DEER totters from the wreck, thrashing. Scene from a nightmare. Nightmare part two: from the snow, from the human-shaped divot -- arises a woman of blood. She stumbles from the drift. Toward the wreck. And though it's clearly Sam Caine under all that crimson, there's  something wrong about her *eyes*. En route to the car, she kneels beside the suffering deer its flesh scorched and torn -- and KILLS it. Puts it away with a sharp CRACK-!ing blow to the head. Stands, eyes  squirming with madness... The car's an inferno. Earl is dead. She turns away, wipin blood from her eyes -- Comes face to face with a SNOWMAN. A jolly white fellow. Charcoal briquettes for eyes. She  watches, fascinated, as he MELTS in the blast furnace hea With warning, she *screams*. Crumples to the ground. The snowman's eyes fall out. He melts away and away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere. Tract housing, late-model cars. MITCH HENESSEY delivers a Christmas gift to his nine year-old son TODD: just any gift, the *Midtown Saturn Orbiting Precinct*, wi action figures. Henessey points to the box, engrossed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and here's the jail here, see...?  Escape chute for the Borian, he's a  dinosaur guy, Moves quick, don't  take no shit neither. See, you can  make him shoot the guard -- ah, hell,  look, I played with it a little  myself, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE interrupts them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TODD, TIME FOR DINNER. NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward pause. Henessey scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you go ahead, um... hope you  like the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's awesome, Dad. Mom, though, she... (sighs) She gets weird. On my birthday, when  you gave me the Schwinn... she called  bicycle stores to see if there'd  been any robberies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey manages to control his face. Says tightly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I don't steal them locally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches, forlorn, as his son vanishes inside the house Christmas lights, blinking feebly. We HEAR, supered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Ma: Filled out the child support  stuff last week. Office got pissed,  under ex-spouse I put "Spawn of Satan,  Dweller in Eternal Dark." Just being  honest, Ma, lady wants me to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches his car, his BEEPER goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey on the phone. Dials. Waits. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go without a ripple, that's the  truth. Ex-con. Ex-husband. Expired.  Thanks, Ma, for hiding the truth  from me for so long. Or maybe you  believed in me. I miss you. I hope  you believed, even for a day. No one  did, Ma. No one at all. It's cold  here. I'm sorry you're dead. Your  son, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone picks up. He says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, we got a bite on amnesia  chick's photo. Found a guy remembers  seeing her, fall of '87. He wants  cash, should I grease him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no! Use your head, girl. Let  the fucker squeeze the Charmin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? Guy's hideous. I'll do  it, but we're talking time and a  half. Plus a night on the town when  I get back, and *no cockfights this  time*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, having survived. Laid up now in an austere hosp room. Listening to silence. Stares out the window at a su tree. Head bandaged. Frowns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a cigarette, why do I want a  cigarette...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, snow slithers... Her eyelids, slowly closing. Sl off the edge of consciousness... IN THE DREAM: She stands on a windswept cliff, before an  incongruous FULL-LENGTH MIRROR. Staring at her reflection it's bleeding from a scalp wound. She probes her head... frowns. Nothing. Nothing but the t RIDGED SCAR she's had for as long as she can remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what do you want...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reflection eyes her grimly. Haggard. Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) You used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is suddenly holding a cigarette. She raises it t her lips. Her reflection MIRRORS her precisely. Except  Samantha COUGHS, chokes on the smoke -- While her bloody  reflection takes a long, satisfying drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, you can drop the act. Nice  and smooth, take another hit. There  you go. See how easy it comes back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now in perfect synchronicity. Sam inhales easily

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *I'm* coming back. You know that,  don't you? Name's Charly, by the  way. You're gonna love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reflection grins. There's blood on its TEETH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at home, business as usual, pre-Christmas. A COMMOTI has arisen: Gingerly, bones still aching, Samantha moves  toward the KITCHEN. HAL and CAITLIN trail behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you can't cook, I'm not wrong  about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm *remembering*, Hal. Things are  coming back. Trust me, I'm a chef, I  know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, make her stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush. Go to the garage and get me  something, anything. A veggie, go,  man, go! I'm hot to trot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal worriedly exits to the garage. Plucks a tomato from t fridge, tosses it to Caitlin, who stands in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin turns, tosses it to Sam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who catches it, plops it on the cutting board and proceed to DICE it to SIMTHEREENS. Razor-thin slices. Knife a blu Missing her fingers by millimeters, never faltering, like mad mumblety-pegger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onion, flying in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam catches it. Knife flurries. Pieces, flying up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More. Faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it becomes a bucket brigade. Hal heaves veggies to Ca who spins and relays to Mom who slices, dices, purees, an even makes curly fries. Veggies, incoming. HAL starts to  lose it, starts lobbing them at Caitlin, one after anothe she giggles, starts throwing them overhand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomato. Tomato. Tomato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's a food fight, PELTING Mom, and the floor is  COVERED with food as Hal stumbles in laughing, scoops up  Caitlin -- Samantha shakes her head, grinning, dices to pieces a las lovely radish. Ends with a flourish, TA-DAH-! Doesn't thi Flips the knife point up on ONE FINGER. Tips it for balan Lobs a tomato. Slings the knife without looking, pins it the wall, KA-CHUK--! Everyone goes silent. The knife, quivering. Caitlin and H turn as one, gaping at her. She shrugs numbly. Blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... chefs do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underground. Water GURGLES through overhead pipes. Furnac hum and tick in the sweaty gloom. A SHIRTLESS MAN is tied to a chair. Weeping. Before him,  what looks like a young GQ model. Blonde. Gorgeous. Impec attired. For the record, TIMOTHY. He looks his captive in the eye as the guy blubbers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, man... I don't know why you  gotta kill me... But use the gun,  not the knife. Please. As a fucking  favor, I'm begging you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man... I... I'm scared of the  knife... Shit, I can't handle getting  shots at the doctors, man, PLEASE...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chance. What do you know about  a town called Santa Claus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, *what the fuck is  this*?? I'm FBI, for Chrissake, you  can't do this to me. I don't know  ANYTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy stares him full in the face, eyes narrowed... as  though seeing into his brain. He nods, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't. (beat) I can always tell, you know... If  someone's lying to me. A little skill  of mine, something to trot out at  parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams home the knife. We don't see it, but we FEEL the impact. The FBI man's face contorts in SHOCK. Twisted. In away from Timothy, their eyes lock... A CELLULAR PHONE BEEPS. Timothy reacts, annoyed. Plucks i from his belt and flips it open:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Message from Mr. Daedalus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shrugs at his captive. Rolls his eyes. The guy's still dying, still on the KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's sorry, but he needs you  right away. Something's come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix. I'm just finishing up here.  Then I'm going bunjee jumping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's aware of your weekend plans,  and he apologizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, what's so fucking  important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your old colleague, One-Eyed Jack...?  Recently escaped from a high-security  prison, as you're aware. But listen  to this: prior to his escape, seems  he saw something on TV that disturbed  him. So much he had to be sedated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it, too. It's called "Empty  Nest." How the fuck is it my business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man was overheard talking to  himself under sedation. (beat) He said Charly Baltimore's alive,  sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's incredible, sir, but...  if she were alive, I'm thinking she  might be in contact with the old man  in Pennsylvania. Should I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Picks her up, SPINS HER around, laughing... Henessey and  Nathan stare. Befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: The strange man (let's call him LUKE) stands awkwardly in the dooryard. Shifting from foot to foot. NATHAN watches dispassionately from the tree stump. Gun on his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Look, is this America's Funniest  Practical Videos or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR bangs open and Samantha comes out of the house.  Carrying bandages. Alcohol. Crosses to the tree stump, kn before Nathan. His voice is a harsh rasp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bats her away, administers his own first aid. LUKE pip up, exasperated:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you don't remember  dating me. Charly, please, you pursued  me for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. I caught you and forgot  you. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's December, you'll remember.  Right...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles. Looks at her face. Stops chuckling, takes a  sudden interest in the ground. Sam crosses to HENESSEY,  standing nearby. Takes him aside, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) This is ridiculous. What do we do  with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me, I just work here. Did  you bump pelvises with him or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you kid, Cathead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. Um, could he be  the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (beat) It's coming back, though. All these...  little details about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies Luke. Frowning. Concentrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's got a pin in his leg,  car accident. I know he cuts his own  hair... thinks Rush Limbaugh's an  ass. I know he sits down when he  pees. I know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. You're giving me a stiffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then NATHAN is hit with a dreadful-sounding cough. I wracks him. Doubles him up. LUKE blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, he's *dying*. Let me call  the poor bastard an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan grits his teeth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *No ambulance*. The car I ordered  will be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Windeman, please let him help  you. I know this man, I... I'm pretty  sure I slept with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan presses a bandage to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to faint... And if you  call an ambulance, I will fucking  kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pitches forward into Henessey's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the lakeshore LUKE AND SAMANTHA walk side by side. RACK FOCUS to the porch: NATHAN is laid out on a chaise  lounge. Henessey beside him, applying cold compresses. Th older man stirs, coming awake... Tries to sit up, Henesse nudges him flat again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Charly...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. She's with Luke. That's his  name, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, I told you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, we weren't real big on  what you told us. I had him call you  an ambulance, so shoot me. Should be  here within fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan groans. Henessey presses a cloth to the man's head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's story checks out. Sam knows  things about him. Stuff only a lover  would know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sod that... just watch them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Chick signs my  checks, I'm gonna watch her get aced?  Lie back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan swallows. Grimaces. Lies back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checks. You're not fooling anyone,  dear boy. (bemused) You'd wash her feet and drink the  water... wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut me a break, nimrod. She's married  with a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busted. Nathan coughs. Speaks, eyes faraway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My star pupil... (smiles thinly) That man in Pennsylvania yesterday...  The one at the diner, that was hers,  wasn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I saw the news report, they found a  shell casing a thousand yards away,  helluva shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Daedalus, what's his  story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arms broker, man without a face.  Veteran of Baader-Meinhoff and the  Red Brigades. He's rumored to be  based in the U.S. Doesn't travel  much, they say. Too afraid of metal  detectors, the poor sod's got a foot- long piece of steel in his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At which point, Henessey stops. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pin, Mr. Henessey. A surgical pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scuffs his shoe in the porch dust. Eyes narrowed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell...? I know I just  heard that somewhere, something about  a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes widen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points to the lake:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan, that son of a bitch has one  in *his* leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan freezes, thoughts racing... swears violently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blithering idiot, the son of a  bitch wasn't her lover, he was her  target, he's Daedalus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...! That's how she knew  all that shit, not from *dating* him --  she *studied* the fucker to take him  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off for the lake at a dead run. Behind him, the  bloodied Nathan DRAGS himself to his feet and lurches off the porch, stumbling. Weaving. Refusing to go down. AT THE LAKESIDE -- Luke walks behind Samantha. Talking so in her ear, smiling... She hears something. A RATCHETING  noise, drawing closer, hmmm...? Looks up. Wishes she hadn A BELL RANGER HELICOPTER is descending over the lake. Ins TIMOTHY shoulders a bolt action rifle, coolly professiona FIRES, kicks up dirt at Henessey's feet. Stops the fucker cold. On the shore, LUKE smiles at Samantha, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure don't look like an ambulance,  does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLUGS HER IN THE FACE. Drops her to the ice like a broken doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black indeed. Deep. Empty. Out of the darkness, we hear a NEWS COMMENTATOR. Voice scratchy. Indistinct. Far away or long ago... A TELEVISION IMAGE fills the screen. Black and white. Gra The legend: BELFAST, NORTHERN IRELAND, over footage of a  sidewalk bombing. We're back in time, the year 1971. A cr looking BRIGADIER is speaking to the off-camera reporter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the bombing has been linked to  the Ulster Volunteer Force, which,  as you know, is the counterpart of  the provisional IRA and the most  violent of the Protestant Paramilitary  groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANNOUNCER's face replaces him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite threats of reprisals,  Brigadier Baltimore repeats that he  will seek to cut UVF supply lines,  especially from Tripoli, Lybia. U.S.  President Nixon concurs that...

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: A battered TV, volume turned low. Snoozing in a chair, a  rumpled older man -- It's the BRIGADIER, the one we just speaking on TV. A CALENDAR on the table identifies the da as June 23, 1971.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE NEXT ROOM
dialogues.text: Girlish decor. Pinups of rock stars. A YOUNG GIRL is awak dressed and currently stuffing two pillows under a blanke She inspects her handiwork. Human-looking lump. Turns,  satisfied. One last look at the WOODEN JESUS on the wall -- Creeps f the room. Past the sleeping Brigadier. To the front door. She checks over her shoulder, nervous. Taps out five digi Shuts off the alarm. Unlocks the door and slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy's name is GREGORY. Sixteen, with a quick, easy gr Huddled beneath a tree with him, the girl is gelatin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never made it with a boy,  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing odd about it. I'm  only sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fourteen and not a day more.  Here now, I'm right, you're blushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what if I'm ignorant? It's my  father, we never stay in one place,  I never meet bloody anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw him on the telly. Think he'd  kill me? I'm a nasty one, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides a hand under her sweater. She stiffens, terrifi and exhilarated, as he gently strokes her nipple with a t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I'll bet you've never  even kissed a boy... now, have you? (beat) Aye, but you want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in. She leans forward. A jerky, tentative duckli on the road to swan-dom. Their lips touch. Across the road, THE WINDOWS BLOW OUT in her father's fla She spins, scream caught in her throat -- as ARMED MEN ru from the house. Through the door, the one she left unlock Stutter of SMALL ARMS FIRE. She whirls on Gregory, realiz only then that the guy is LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for shutting off the alarm,  you bloody Papist bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps her full across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the press the Ulster Force claims  full credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins and flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, moving. Walls racing past, shot to PIECES, run run into her bedroom and LURCHES to a stop, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *DA*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Propped against the wall. By the bed. He's still alive.  Incredibly. The man has DRAGGED himself in here. He refus to die, simply couldn't, you see... Not until he reached daughter.

dialogues.speaker: BED
dialogues.text: Two pillows, jammed beneath a blanket. The Brigadier just stares at them. His face slack. White and gastly. Shifts gaze to his daughter. Tears running from his dulled eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the pistol to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...did they pay you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires. On a young girl's dissolve into insanity we FAD OUT... Sound, echoing away. Blackness, total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waking is slow. Samantha opens her eyes. Blinks. Hazy, out of focus. Trie to rub her eyes, can't. Hands. Something's wrong, what th hell'd she do with her hands...? Ah. They're stretched ov her head. BOUND WITH CORD. Suddenly she's very awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement of the old converted mill. A drafty, windswe place full of old, broken timbers. A river runs through i A stream, at any rate. The waters are still and frozen no Above the stream -- A GREAT WOODEN WHEEL. Smaller corolla of the wheel outside. Mounted on the same axis. SAMANTHA is tied to that wheel. Lashed to its SIDE, affix to it like a goddess to a Greek sailing ship. Now the bad news, the ice has been chopped away so the wheel can TURN And it will plunge Samantha UNDER THE FREEZING WATER. Ben the ice. Bound hand and foot. Strapped to the wheel, wear only a nightgown, she is utterly helpless. THE MAN KNOWN AS DAEDALUS (AKA Luke) stands before her, g instructions to the ubiquitous TIMOTHY. He looks up at  Samantha. Seeing her eyelids flutter, he tosses her a che wave. Gone is the gee-whiz country boy schtick; in its pl a frightening arrogance. He tosses her his cheeriest wave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good afternoon. If it isn't  the forgetful spy. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not-so fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha struggles against her bonds. No dice. Subsides.  Takes a look around at her predicament. TIMOTHY stands at the edge of the ice. Watching her intently. Smiles thinly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you're... the man from the  bar...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her. She's not faking it,  she doesn't know me from Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daedalus shakes his head, frowning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that I don't trust my  compatriot, Colonel Baltimore. In  fact, I had every confidence that  your amnesia was genuine -- until  you showed up *here*. You follow? (beat) Meanwhile, I just got around to  reading the papers, there's the small  matter of an incident upstate. Long  range rifle shot, blew a man out of  his socks. (coldly) You can see where I'm coming from.  I'm trying to pull of the biggest  job of my career. I have to know.  How much you really remember... and  who you've told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell a soul, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll soon know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses toward a large RED BUTTON. Set into a wooden b Samantha thrashes at the bindings. Looks down at the wate where it intercepts the mammoth wheel. Fighting panic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is... is this a torture thing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torture, yes. The torturing of  beautiful women, albeit politically  incorrect, is an addiction with me. (beat) A woman never looks quite so beautiful  as when her face is distended in  pain. Witness the beauty of  childbirth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I'm getting all misty. Look,  untie me, I'll make any face you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not, and say we did. Do you  smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke...? Um, no. Not... not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You'll last longer. Now hush  yourself, and take a deep breath.  We're gonna do the torture thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the button. An electric WHINE -- THE BIG WHEEL TU Feet first into the water. Struggling. Arms stretched abo her head. She plunges below the surface. A new dimension PAIN. Frozen, mind-numbing. She WRITHES against the wheel. It's like a crushing VICE ripping her limb from limb. She opens her eyes, briefly.  Discovers she's not alone -- A mere foot from her face, T BLOATED CORPSE of the drowned NATHAN. Staring away and aw Blue with cyanosis. Meanwhile, back ON THE SURFACE: Daedalus turns to his rig hand man, who says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running on schedule, I just  secured the tanker. We're borrowing  it from Carbide in South Carolina.  Cargo listed as fire retardant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Juice up the bird, we head out soon  as I'm done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. Hits the red button again. THE WHEEL reverses  itself. Creaks and moans, turning -- SAMANTHA BREAKS THE SURFACE. Gasping for air. Wheezing.  Choking. The FREEZING WIND plasters the nightgown to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take all the air you can, that's  right. If you need to vomit, do it  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, face twisted. Coughs. Wheezes. TIMOTHY looks he in the eye... shakes his head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember *at all*...? The  greatest night of your life, shit,  drown this ungrateful wench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. Daedalus, alone with his captive. On her featur unbridled HATRED. He chuckles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me Colonel. Is my identity  safe...? The truth, and I'll shoot  you in the head. Nice and quick.  Otherwise, you're in for a long night.  *Who did you talk to*?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nobody... fuck you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, makes a "tsk tsk" gesture. Smiles gri as he turns his attention to the red switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to see you like this, Charly. I  heard you were a helluva spy once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, her head snaps upward -- Eyes cold. Voic not her own:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your back. I'm not done yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a very funny joke. You're an  entertaining woman. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the button. She plunges beneath the surface. Daed walks over to one corner. Sits down. Takes out a pipe. Li it. Picks up a book. Reads. And reads. UNDERWATER -- Sam THRASHES and jerks, to and fro. Dead Na mocking her. There, under the water, the memories come... a flood. Stark and vivid.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY FLASH
dialogues.text: THE TRUNK OF A CAR opens, revealing a patch of night sky. Mostly obscured by two familiar individuals -- There's ONE-EYED JACK, remember him? Few years younger. O eyeball heavier. The other man is TIMOTHY. He looks in th trunk. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll signal Daedalus. Your  money will be waiting, and Jack...?  Do yourself a favor, do her and dump  her, I'm serious. Don't get cute,  try to play doctor first. I made  that mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid SLAMS SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: BACK UNDER THE WATER
dialogues.text: The world of rushing MADNESS, memories unspooling now, fa and faster -- MEMORY FLASH: A CLIFF overlooking the ocean. Darkness.  Sheeting rain. Our heroine (for it is unquestionably SAMA is lying unconscious atop a rocky bluff. Drenched. ONE-EYED JACK produces a SYRINGE from a leather case. Rol up her sleeve. Starts to administer the injection. Stops. can't resist... Can't help LOOSENING the buttons on her s Her eyes snap open. And before it even registers, she's  grabbed the hypodermic and plunged it deep INTO HIS EYE - Then she's up and running. Along the cliff, toward the ca Jack, HOWLING in pain, stumbling... Draws his gun and sho her. In the head. She pitches backward. Tumbles from the cliff...! Rushes  headlong toward the waters below, getting smaller --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Now. She breaks the surface. Gasping for breath.  SHRIEKS, a sound ripped from her by the PAIN, the COLD -- By her ruptured sanity. She hangs there. Drenched. Half  frozen. DAEDALUS can't help it. A chill dances up his spine,  watching... She is not afraid. She is not whimpering. She looking directly AT HIM. With a sick smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daedalus... Make you a deal... Let  me go now...? I'll leave you the use  of your legs... Bargain, trust me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daedalus struggles to recover his poise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you find me? Who knows about  this place, WHO HAVE YOU TOLD?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly's eyes bore into his:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let you touch me, cowboy... I think  I need a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daedalus stabs the red button. THE BIG WHEEL TURNS... Int the water goes Charly. Going down for the third time.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE WATER
dialogues.text: Here we are again, in the world of silence and blinding P Despair and madness but now there's something else -- Now there's RAGE. It takes losing most of the FLESH from her right wrist... But she frees the hand. WRENCHES it loose. The water turn soupy red around it. GROPES, blindly. Fingers NUMB, so fu cold -- Breath, running out. No air. NO TIME. She darts her right hand forward. Toward the obscenely bo CORPSE of Nathan. Does something grotesque, jams her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hideaway gun, it's right where he said, right beside Mr.  Wally. PSP-25. Semi-auto, steel jackets. She waits. Rage  inside her. Death in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, BACK ON THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: The wheel CREAKS. Groans. The terrorist in the western bo watches her emerge, face first -- She comes up firing. The first slug takes him in the knee. Blows it to scraps. collapses, howling. She shifts aim. THE RED BUTTON. No  hesitation. BLAM-! Hits it DEAD ON. Stops the wheel.  Incredible. Doesn't blink. Unties her captive hand. BLOWS TO SPLINTER the wood surrounding her feet. Leaps to solid ground, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daedalus looks up from his prone position. In agony. A vi from Hell approaches: A fiendish blue-skinned woman in a  sodden nightgown. Blood leaking from one wrist. She has r REBORN, from the icy waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha... Please...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Samantha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots him in the other knee. He HOWLS. Gun, empty. S tosses it aside. In a nearby crate: ASSAULT RIFLES. Snatc up a Kalashnikov and clip. Kneels and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see in the movies, badguy says,  "Talk to me and I'll let you live."  We're gonna run a variation, it goes  like this: Talk to me...? I'll let  you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Henessey...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective lies naked, bound hand and foot. Beaten.  FREEZING. A single ray of LIGHT through a tiny crack. He hears a SPLINTERING noise, as if a door's been ripped  from its hinges. Pause -- A FUSILLADE of gunfire. Shouts, cries. A heavy weight SLAMS to the floorboards above him. Through a crack comes a tiny stream of BLOOD, dribbling o him, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMOTHY bolts from the house, clutching a bleeding hand.  Running hellbent for leather. Reaches a parked car. Leaps and kicks over the engine as, behind him -- MORE MEN come piling out of the house, shouting. Running their cars -- never make it. CUT DOWN IN THEIR TRACKS. Wr by gunfire, bodies twitching... And as Timothy PEELS OUT, spraying mud, we pull UP, UP, A AWAY... Into the sky, moving ever higher, gunfire fading. Until now we're WAY UP, we can see Timothy's car... the O MILL, ever so tiny below us... It blows to pieces. Sends flaming boards flying STRAIGHT AT US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as PERKINS stalks in, shedding his c His aide -- let's call him HARRY -- looks up nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't happen, Harry. The  President's already up at night,  prowling his sock drawer for double  agents, and now we've got a fucking  rogue on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there's someone in the conference  room to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for the love of Christ, who can  be so fucking important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open a door off the passage: THERE'S TIMOTHY.  Perched on the edge of a conference table, tamping a pack smokes. Perkins reacts, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, your poor black cousin. The  one you can't be seen with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *You*...! Are you crazy, coming here??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lights a cigarette) My boss is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your rogue bitch just took him out.  Probably went shopping in his weapons  storage too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows smoke. Trains his eyes on the older man. Piercin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still on, Perkins. I've got  the tanker, the chemist, all ready  to go... but you gotta contain her,  man. We gotta step on her hard and  fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agent on the SWITCHBOARD calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a call on line three, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly Baltimore, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins stops dead. Lunges for the phone, nearly drops it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins.

dialogues.speaker: OUR HEROINE AT PAY PHONE
dialogues.text: We only see her mouth. Set in hard, grim lines. She says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold, I want to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly...? Oh, my God, what the hell  are you *doing*? Listen to me, I'm  going to direct you to a safe house,  get you on a plane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can the bullshit, I'm not telling  you where I am. I'll come in for a  full debriefing, but we do it my  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly, you're being paranoid. It's  not like it used to be, you're eight  years out of date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congress won't authorize a dime,  Charly. Chapter's on the way out,  we've been reduced to a records- keeping agency, we *don't have enough  money to kill you*, understand...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Perkins. If you want me  dead, you'll pass a hat in the typing  pool to buy bullets. We do things my  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your way, I see. And if I say go to  hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where I stand, it ain't much of  a commute. You'll hear from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clicks off. Perkins darts a look at the techie -- guy shakes his head, no go on the trace. Perkins swears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mustn't threaten our success.  Contain her, whatever it takes. But  be *careful*. If it gets out you're  working for me... we'll both be  grabbing our ankles on the White  House lawn.

dialogues.speaker: ATLANTIC CITY, NEW JERSEY
dialogues.text: There. Thank you, New Jersey, that'll be all. You can go  now. Um, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waking is slow for Mitch Henessey. He swallows dryly. Eye creak open, struggle to focus... Hears WATER running. A  shower. Squints at his watch. He's not wearing a watch, h knew that... In BED, naked. Chest swathed in bandages, wh the hell...? He pokes them. Jerks his head, hissing in pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey lights a smoke at the bar. Flicks the match in a trashcan. Starts to go, stops... Reaches into the can. Pl out a tiny scrap: PHOTOGRAPH, ripped in two. A photo of Hal and Caitlin. He pockets it, disturbed. Crosses to the bathroom door. T shower has stopped. Raises a tentative hand, starts to  knock... It OPENS. There, in a thin silk robe, is a WOMAN swabbing at her hair. She breezes out of the bathroom all chipper, like nothing unusual. Notices Henessey cursorily. Raises a finger: "on sec." Lowers her head and shakes it like a terrier, spray him. He cannot stop staring. It's Samantha, it *has* to be... Now she's BLONDE, though. Hair clipped short. Bobbed. Blo red fingernails. Red cotton shift, legs for days. Then, she *smiles* at him -- and it's not her, not Samant Amnesia's over, folks, because we're clearly looking at a changed woman: This one's name is CHARLY BALTIMORE, and s hasn't seen the light of day in eight years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mitch. Glad you're awake. Uh- oh, you're seeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a washcloth. Frowns, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she opens her robe and exposes her breasts.  Henessey perks up considerably -- then SCREAMS as she RIP the gauze from his chest. She clinchs the robe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that hurt like shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I distracted you first. (dabs at his wounds) Same principle as breaking in virgins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as -- virgins, *what*...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw it in a Harold Robbins book. Guy  bites her on the ear as he goes in.  Distracts from the pain. You ever  try that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I slug 'em in the jaw and yell  "pop goes the weasel," what the fuck  are you talking about? Who are you??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Charly. The spy. Nice to  meet'cha. Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey watches, fascinated. All the little mannerisms, differences. Shaking out a match, running a hand through hair... And never missing a thing, eyes constantly roving scanning. Guard never down. She plucks a drink from a nea table, steals it outright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Sit next to the dance floor,  every drink's free. People finish  dancing, they think the waiter lifted  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey grimaces. Clears his throat, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused. Gimme a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take two, they're small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocks back her drink. No hesitation. Henessey shifts uncomfortably, lights a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's say I buy it. You're  actually a trained killer, Jesus, I  can't even say it with a straight  face. (frowns) So then... Samantha, she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never really existed. Like Nathan  said, she was a total fabrication, I  made her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrication. And now she's just...  gone? Forever and ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. Look at my inordinately  large ass, look what she did to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey squirms, this one's gonna take some time to dige

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty convincing act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, her personality, it had to  come from *somewhere* --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change the subject. Better yet, steal  me another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey sighs. Next to him a couple get up to dance. He  reaches over and lifts their beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up. What's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Chapter. I'm trying to bring  us in from the field alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter. Can you trust them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure. Until I know, you might  wanna stay away from curbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, confused:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They like to push people in front of  buses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't need to know that. A DANCING SANTA goes by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bad Caribbean accent) Hey, lady, Santa want to dance the  lambada wit'choo. *Come this way,  everybody*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shimmies away. Charly grins at Henessey:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could come that way I wouldn't  need to dance the lambada. Follow  me, I need you to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey hunches forward, speaks rapidly into the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The lady's whacked, Trin, she's  lost it and I want fucking out, now  *call the Feds*. She's moving us  tonight, I'll sneak out to this phone,  call you back at midnight with the  details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up quickly. Turns -- reveal CHARLY, lounging a f away, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Charly. What did that  accomplish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm testing our boy Perkins. I figure  he's gotta be tapping your office.  Got a light...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, then:) Oh, no. He just traced that call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swipes matches from his pocket. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come midnight, you hang by the phone.  Nobody shows, we think about trusting  him. He tries to kidnap and torture  you, well, there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, time out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't be such a baby. (lights her cigarette) Ten o'clock, we got two hours to  kill. I'm a woman, feed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARNIVAL RIDES, dead for the winter. Henessey and Charly  stroll beneath them. He smokes. She eats Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. God I'm full, I'm gonna have a  food baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a good long look at her, still can't fathom it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Charly." fucking unbelievable. (beat) Shame about the fat ass. I bet you  were really attractive once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I was. Check this out. One time?  A guy said he'd fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he make good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Oh, and afterwards? Oh  my God, afterwards I said the most  funny thing, you know what I said...? (beat) I said, "Go back to your room. Dad..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs through a swig of beer. MEMORY FLASH: Charly's bedroom as DAD puts the gun to his head and fires, CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's why he thought I had him killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey huddles, watching her closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, gazes out over the icy waters. Speaks, her voic faraway and gone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Da died, I went to his funeral.  12 years old, today I wouldn't. And  I overheard a woman, she was  praying... She was thanking God --  sounded so happy -- thanking Him it  hadn't been *her* father who was  killed. See... she didn't really  care that God had let someone die...  just so long as it missed *her*. (beat) ...and she bought her cross at the  same store as mine, see, that's what  we do, we all pray to the same cross  on a hundred different walls, and  sit back and wait to see who gets  hit and who gets missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger flares in her eye. Like a stirring of mud at the bo of a deep, deep, pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the waiting. Fuck being afraid.  I determine who gets hit, and how  hard. And I thank no one. It's  pathetic to thank someone who spares  you -- when they're just taking  someone else. (beat) Walk me upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the suite. She drops her purse, sways toward h Presses him against the wall, framed there in the doorway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my first date in eight years,  Mitch. Is this a fun date...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite suddenly, Charly leans over and kisses him on the l He reacts, startled. Stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True love, shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding me? I'm an ex-con, lady.  I wear a shiny suit, my tie's crooked,  and the last time I got blown candy  bars cost a nickel. Plus I'm ugly,  so what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemistry. Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nibbles his ear. Pulls back, smiling -- and Henessey' holding the picture of HAL and CAITLIN. The one he found  torn in two. He looks her full in the face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chemistry my ass. Know what I think?  I think this is why you'd fuck me. (beat) To kill a schoolteacher. Bury any  trace of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I liked the schoolteacher.  When she comes back, give me a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly jerks backward. Angry. Henessey heads for the bath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and call your fuckin' kid, will  ya'? It's two days to Christmas, and  she's under the mistaken impression  that Mommy gives a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly snatches up her purse, eyes burning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for the kid, Mitch.  Samantha had the kid, not me, NOBODY  ASKED ME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly stalks the city streets. A quartet sings, "God Res Ye Merry," ostensibly about joy, oddly the most depressin tune ever written. On a crowded street, she is alone. Tot misfit. Searches her own haggard features in a shop windo Swallows hard, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, baby. She ain't coming back,  no way. Bitch is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bustles down a sidestreet, hands jammed in her pocket That's when a tall BEARDED MAN crosses the street and fal in alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see me a good-looking lady, all  upset, I wonder if she doesn't need  some male company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I'm saving myself 'til I  get raped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand edges out of his windbreaker with a snubnosed .3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step into the alley, honey. I ain't  asking, I'm telling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly stops walking. Regards him the way you or I might  look at a telephone cord. Groans:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't tell me. You're early,  Goddammit, you're supposed to be at  the pay phone. Go away and come back  at midnight. I'm not ready yet. Got  a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy stares, mouth working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, I have a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is precisely when a much larger Smith and Wesson CO next to his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't no ham on rye, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENESSEY holds the gun rock steady in his big fist. Charl spins on him, eyes flashing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving your life. Woulda got here  sooner but I was thinking up the  sandwich line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I couldn't take him?  *Idiot*, you probably scared the  other guy away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other guy -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headhunters, nimrod, they go in pairs,  were you always this stupid or did  you take lessons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I TOOK LESSONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hitman watches, bewildered. Considers waving to get t attention. Finally he can't stand it. Blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly snaps her head toward him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *What*?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still got this fucking gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes it off him. Just like that. He stares dumbly at his empty hand. Half of his trigger finger is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIIIIT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly flips the gun into the air. Launches a SPIN KICK.  Shatters his jaw. Catapults him backwards. Completes her spin, catlike -- Catches the .38 on its way down. DOESN'T STOP THERE. Arm out, gun cocked -- FIRES.  Straight at Henessey, what...? He dives aside -- BEHIND HIM, a second HITMAN. Blown to tatters. The KNIFE  meant for Henessey arcs through the air... Imbeds itself in the ground an inch from the prone detect He stares at it with shocked eyes. The killer hits, dead. Twitches. CHARLY. Lowers her arm slowly. Gun barrel smoki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Just fuck all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BRONCO ROARS UP out of a parking garage. Swerves and pl into the maze of streets that inspired the world's most  popular board game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly drives, possessed. Henessey drinks. Hands shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit. I knew I couldn't trust that  prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a shrieking skid. Henessey clutches for the  dashboard, swearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Spike. I got myself out of  Beirut once, I think I can get us  out of New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so sure, others have tried.  The entire population, in fact. (beat) Look, about me...? I mean, what's  up, you're this hot survival chick,  I'm getting the feeling you don't  need me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly reaches over. Yanks the doorhandle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks him out of the moving car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bounces off the highway. Rolls. Over and over, shudder to a stop. Pause... The wind blows. He groans. Looks up,  spits gravel. Stands. Dusts himself off. Watches the Bron go far away.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: As Henessey trudges wearily down the highway we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Mom: I was tortured, now I'm in  Atlantic City. The girl of my dreams  just threw me out of a speeding car.  Now more people will come an shoot  me in the head. On the plus side, I  won two bucks at video poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREECH of tires, he turns, startled -- here comes the  Bronco. Skids onto the highway and races back toward him. Pulls up alongside. CHARLY throws open the door, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Without a word. Closes the door, they drive off. lights a cigarette like nothing happened. Shakes out the  match, speaks without looking at her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found a use for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. (beat) I gotta vanish, Mitch. I need money,  a whole bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say so? Gimme a second  while I pull it out of my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him, a gleam in her eye. Speaks softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key, Mitch. The one I keep around  my neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you it's the key to  Box 406 at Pittsburgh International  Airport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know? Someone filed  off the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not someone. Me. I filed them off. (beat) There's a briefcase in Box 406, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey does a spit-take, sprays whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payment for my last assignment. I  need you to retrieve it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid, they might have the  place covered. I don't want to get  shot to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda known. (sighs) Gimme the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to. I left it with Caitlin  back in Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRONCO races on into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late, very late now. Henessey, driving. Beside him, Charl reclines, lost in reverie. Features bathed in passing  roadlights. Henessey grinds out a butt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor me: you're a paid assassin,  then you fall off a cliff. Sink under  the ocean, and when you come out  you're a fucking schoolmarm, wanna  tell me what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell into a school of fish, they  elected me principal. Shut the fuck  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Personally...? I'm thinking  maybe Samantha Caine wasn't an act.  Maybe you forgot to hate yourself  for eight years, ever think of  that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut. The. Fuck. Up. Hmmm... Nope,  seems clear enough to me. Hate myself,  Christ almighty. What are you, my  shrink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just some loser thought he could  maybe understand, fuck it. I been  there, you know. I'd kill for fucking  amnesia. I'm with my boy and all I  can think is I got reamed in the ass  by three guys. Merry Christmas, son,  here's a ball glove, did you know  Daddy screamed when they carved the  name in his back...? Mary, by the  way. I pushed for Cindy, but hell.  God, I'm tired. (beat) I never did one thing right, you  know it, not one fucking thing. Not  even accidental, that takes skill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over. She's asleep, hasn't heard a word. Face sl lips slightly parted. The toughness banished from her  features. In its place, a lingering sadness. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bronco glides along. Charly in the passenger seat, ey roving like a hawk's. THE CAINE HOUSE is peaceful and qui Christmas lights, still burning dimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive past, don't slow down. (points) Park under those trees, honk if  there's trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bad Rochester) Yas, massah, I be slowin' de caw  down fo' you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stuffs a .45 automatic in her waistband. Cradles an M beneath her coat. Rolls out of the still-moving truck. Ma her way through back yards. Silent as a cat. She went to  cookouts here. Bridge parties. Now she prowls, a grim  assassin. Leaps a fence, drops behind a woodpile -- Comes face to f with RAYMOND, a fifth grade student we saw earlier. Secre behind the woodpile, SMOKING. His eyes pop as he spies go ol' Ms. Caine, sporting blonde hair and an assault weapon Charly doesn't miss a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... morning, Ms. Caine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we learn about the dangers  of smoking...? Give it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wet stain appears at his crotch. He hands her the cigar with nerveless fingers. Charly accepts it. Takes a long,  satisfying drag. Passes it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Tell anyone you saw me I'll  blow your fucking head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves off through the bushes. Out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly kicks aside a pair of abandoned ice skates. Crouch face pressed to the glass door. Looking in. The house is  silent and empty. Nobody home. The Christmas tree winks o and on. The tree she helped decorate. She opens the door slips inside. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three GOVERNMENT AGENTS. Faces drawn, haggard. Pit-staine shirts, day old sandwiches. Carrying photographs of Charl and Henessey. Agent #1 sighs, examining her figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'd eat a mile of her shit just  to follow it back to the ass it came  from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I'm trying to have breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RADIO MIC on the dash squawks, a voice says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unit 2 to Red Dog, give us one more  pass, let's make sure the house is  secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly enters. All business. Begins to systematically rif the drawers. Her daughter's precious things. Sweeps every onto the floor. Utter disregard, it's a bit startling. Crosses to the bed, throws back the covers -- MR. PERKINS (the stuffed bear) has the chain around his neck. We hear it, then. Ghosting on the still air, barely audib the sound of SINGING... Children's voices waft across the frozen pond from St. Paul's Episcopal CHURCH. Charly frow Crosses to the window, lifts the sash. Pause. Charly chews her lip. Unlimbers the MP-5. Hefts th wicked-looking thing. Not to fire it... but to use the SC Adjusts focus. Practiced movements. Deft. Sure. Sights do the weapon. Scans though the gunsights... POV CHARLY: Hal's CHRISTMAS PAGEANT. There's Hal. Cast in spectral GREEN. Laughing and serving breakfast. On the ch lawn, a NATIVITY scene. Teenage girls as the wise men. Ch of children, singing... CAITLIN among them. Charly is sweating. She lowers the scope. Squeezes her ey shut. Something in her, threatening to WRENCH LOOSE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey, slouched behind the wheel. Starts to light a  cigarette. Stops, the match halfway to his face. Eyes riv on the rearview mirror as a GOVERNMENT SEDAN turns the co behind him...

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: Watching her family, far away. Fighting emotion. That's w she hears A HORN HONKING. Her head whips around, toward t front of the house. The honk is followed by three GUNSHOT in rapid succession. She's up and moving. All else forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey PEELS OUT, tires smoking. Careens forward, gover SEDAN close behind -- The upstairs window EXPLODES outward. Charly, hurtles thr Freefalls to the porch roof. Glass, showering down. Hits, rolls. Surfaces in a combat crouch, FIRES. Government sedan, KILLS THE PASSENGER. Collapses him over the doorframe. Gun clatters to the street, car speeds off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver looks over, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. Goddammit, how did that  happen??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Go bulletproof, now*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver hits a button and up go the windows. All, that is, except the passenger side window -- Because the dead  guy's bald HEAD blocks it. Becomes WEDGED there. Bald pat exposed to the world.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: Charly watches the two vehicles rocketing away down the  street. Out of range. Lowers the smoking .45. SWEARS. Tak off around the house at a dead run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch scenery: the Christmas Pageant, CAITLIN and fellow angels traipse into the church vestibule... Caitlin looks just in time to see TIMOTHY apply the chloroform. Two seconds, she's out like a light. Next case. Up and mo child tucked neatly under his arm. A NEARBY MOTHER OF THR has seen it happen. Opens her mouth to scream -- He palms KNIFE. Puts it to her youngest son's kidney:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna be a statistic, lady? You're  about to have 2.4 children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freezes her. Petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where you live. Close your  mouth, you look like a fish. Merry  Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits into the vestibule. Quick. Professional.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, BACK AT THE RANCH
dialogues.text: High speed chase, in progress. The driver dogs Henessey,  jockeys for position. Barks into a radio mic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target two, acquired! Red Dog in  pursuit, backup requested. (over his shoulder) You got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backseat agent hefts an AK-47 assault rifle.
