dialogues.text: Henessey checks the rear view mirror -- just in time to s a circular portion of glass POP from the chase car's wind Out comes a gun muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus wept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy opens up on full auto. Rakes the Bronco, STRAFES Henessey swerves madly -- no go. Death run. He's not comi home, not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY BALTIMORE hurtles forward, SPEED SKATING across th frozen pond toward the chase vehicles. Long, coltish legs to die for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gross, this is gonna be so  Goddamn gross...

dialogues.text: She goes SIDESLIPPING at superhuman speed. Tacks alongsid the government sedan. Targets the bald guy's head. Raises the .45 and FIRES. Not to be graphic, but the car's drive receives the bulk of the mess. SPRAYED. Across the eyes. He loses control, SKIDS OUT. Catapults o the road, onto the ice. Slides right toward Charly, *stil doing fifty*... She doesn't miss a beat. LAUNCHES herself, twisting in  midair... Up OVER THE HOOD of the sedan, it blows by  underneath her as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The incredible part. In slow motion, she does a DOUBLE AX PIRHOUETTE. Above the hood. Mid-spin, she blows THREE SHO through the windshield. Kills everyone. Keeps going. The spins twice around. PLOWS to a halt -- Charly hits a pict perfect landing. On the shore, HENESSEY watches, thunderstruck. Charly ska by the icebound sedan. Flashes a grin at the dying driver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... it really... *is* you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil...? Phil Krauss? I don't believe  it, they moved you from cyphers.  Long time, man, I figured you were  dead by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She delivers a blow to the neck. Kills him. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey and Charly, driving a new vehicle: late model  Cadillac. Charly driver. Henessey rifles the glove  compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mitch. Still think I'm warm and  fuzzy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's not your fault the gun  accidentally went off in mid-air as  you tripped and flew over the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. What's in the glove box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone bill, Christmas card... Five  buck, swell. You didn't have to kill  him, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, man. Do I tell you how to  snap photos of extramarital blowjobs?  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a short, CHIRPING sound. Seemingly from nowhere. They exchange puzzled looks, what the hell...? Charly abr realizes it's coming from her purse. She reaches in, scoo up the CELLULAR PHONE, the one she told Caitlin to call.  Thumbs the button. Says cautiously:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice, then... Clipped tones, TIMOTHY'S voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, I got your kid. Give your  location, we gotta lose the cellular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly. Hand gripped tight on the phone. Pause, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State Road 80, 15 minutes west of  Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's how we do it. Drive to  Harrison, find their main bus stop.  Pay phone, fifteen minutes. Better  drive fast, after five rings I hang  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the kid. Doesn't want to  talk on the airwaves, he's routing  me to a land line. A pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which phone? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective's mind, racing... suddenly it hits him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Service centers...! They list  'em on the back of phone bills, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and find me a gun. HK, MP-5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he rips open the bill we CUT TO: A neutral background, as Charly's HEAD enters frame, we'r very tight on her FACE... Tense, thin-lipped. A PHONE RIN deafening. Click -- Charly speaks tersely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verify you have her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your cellular number off a  cast on her right wrist. Right below  Mommy loves you... Picture of a panda.  Dog, panda, it's got funky ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON CHARLY: Dead still. Made of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want money, Charly. I know you've  got numbered accounts, we all do.  I'll let you know where and when.  Fuck with me...? I'll blind the kid  and shoot out her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, motherfucker. We don't  involve families. It's not the way  it's done, *we don't take families*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Dead silence. HOLD on Charly's face... until slowly, ever so slowly, the camera pulls back to REVEAL: The .45 automatic -- Pointed at the head of an AT&T o THE PHONE COMPANY, they've taken it over. Employees CRING on the floor. Henessey, MP-5 slung on his shoulder, level Charly points to the switchboard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an ANI trace. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set back from the mountain road, a lonely MOTEL. A neon s *Deer Lick Motel*, No vacancies. The sign sits atop a rus pole. Blinks forlornly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMOTHY hangs up and turns to MR. PERKINS, seated across room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done, she hooked. All I gotta  do is set the ransom meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mustn't suspect a trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. She thinks I'm acting alone,  remember? Say the word, I'll hand  her to you on a plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins crosses to the bed. Rubs tired eyes. Gazes down a Caitlin. Asleep, a syringe on the nightstand beside her.  Next to a brown paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. We're monsters, aren't we...? (pause, then:) Forget Charly. Talk to me about  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanker's on its way from  Charleston, ETA 1:00 a.m. One  terrorist on ice, waiting to play  patsy. (points) What's in the sack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins follows his gaze: the brown paper bag. Smiles thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That...? Something to prove that I'm  not a complete ogre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into the paper bag and brings out a BABY DOLL. Sweet, innocent. Frilly with lace. A bright red bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? The young one will have a doll  to play with on Christmas. Very  popular item. It... well, it pees.  You put water in it and... oh, fuck  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly and Henessey, eating at HARDEE'S. Seated across fr each other at an orange plastic table, scarfing Christmas burgers. Outside, a billboard reads: WELCOME TO SANTA CLA *Where it's Christmas all year long*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost dark now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ten minutes. You want my  Crazy Meal action figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass. Listen, you sure we're doing  the right thing? We've got money, we  could negotiate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *I'll get the damn kid*, okay? God,  I hope he doesn't shoot her up. Kid's  dead weight if she's sedated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so emotional, I'm getting  embarrassed with these outbursts  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, balls. Want me to cry on cue? I  can. This is an extraction, nimrod,  and she's the target, that's how to  play it, the only way to beat this  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? How come you know so much about  this fucking guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go there, Mitch, you don't  want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. Suppose you tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, you asked. I bumped pelvises  with this guy. In Paris, back in  1987.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows she's shocking him, rubs it in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been assigned to kill his boss,  remember...? Needed him out of the  way. So I let him seduce me. Had a  steel needle under the pillow, figured  to stick him *en flagrante*, that  means while we were screwing. But he  was too slick. Bashed me in the head,  finished, then threw me in the trunk  of a car. Still think I'm a girl  scout, Mitch...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look in her eyes is feral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost dark. Let's get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full dark now, the fun begins... A TANKER TRUCK rumbles u the mountain road. Pulls up before the Deer Lick Motel. M IN SUITS wield flashlights, motioning the truck forward i a cavernous GARAGE. Inside, men in BLUE JUMPSUITS operate cranes, maneuver a FILL TANK into place above the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, as the tanker enters the garage -- CHARL BALTIMORE drops into frame. Lands and rolls, cat-quick. C up behind a scrawny pine. Scans through a pair of Zeiss  Nightvision binoculars. Welcome to the extraction. No more fun and games, tonight it's a survival-zero operation. HENESSEY appears at her e Lugging the ordnance bag. He sees Charly lower the binocu head in hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Chapter, that's who. Timothy  acting alone, Caitlin had a chance.  Now...? She's dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the tanker snorts to a halt, TIMOTHY pulls up, driving bright red Jaguar. Gets out as a blue-suit trots up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1800 hours. We're still trying to  clean the tanker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scowls annoyance) Fuck the cleaning, just drain it and  reload. Chop-chop, I'm going bunjee  jumping after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly and Henessey. Kneeling. He speaks tersely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. You stomp around like a  forties drunk and you're a lousy  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't hit a lake if you were  standing on the bottom, now shut the  fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly studies the encampment. Armed men. Impossible odds Draws a long ragged breath and flops on the ground. Props her back against a tree. Staring. Lights a cigarette:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns) Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what happened under the water.  That night, eight years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at the sky. Face troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end... there she was, this  pretty little girl at the bottom of  the ocean, smiling at me. Three years  old, didn't know Daddies hid in  closets, not yet. Stared up at me in  the strangest way... saying how'd it  come to this, we were so pretty and  perfect, now look at us, sinking  with our head all open... Said when  she grew up she was gonna teach  school. She couldn't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heaves a sigh. Threads a silencer on a baretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards are on 27-1 megahertz, meet  me at 26-9, you need to talk. As  soon as you spot me with the kid,  start blowing the charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey nods. Pause -- she does something unexpected. Le over and kisses him hard on the lips. He reacts, startled She pulls back, the oddest look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna blow my head off, you  know. (softly:) This is the last time I'll ever be  pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again. Softly. Tenderly. Pulls back, turns without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time now. What I do next, they tell  me it... looks like a machine or  something. You don't like it, don't  look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves off toward the trees. Henessey shifts from foot foot, awkwardly. Opens his mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna say enjoy life, eat out  more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go. (beat) If she's alive, she's coming out of  there, Mitch. If she's not... they'll  know we stopped by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone, like a wraith. CUT TO: SERIES OF SHOTS: Charly, on the prowl. In and out of the  trees... BURYING C-4 CHARGES. In bushes. In snowdrifts. S crawls to woods' edge, peers out -- The motel stands sole and bedraggled. Draws a sharp breath -- ! There's a LIT CANDLE in the window of 17. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: A gray-suited SENTRY. Poised on a wooded slope. He puts a walkie-talkie to his lips and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear.

dialogues.text: CHARLY, out of nowhere. Lightning fast. Hand, clamped on  mouth. In goes the knife. Deep. He burbles blood. Drops.  Before he hits, Charly's already switched from knife to g and moved on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, lady, what are you doing in  there, playing fucking mah-jongg?  *Move*.

dialogues.text: Behind him, a tiny, sharp click--! TIMOTHY has a Skorpion machine pistol aimed at his head. The killer speaks into a radio unit, a single word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogey.

dialogues.text: POP-! go the Kleig lights. BRILLIANCE, blinding -- CATCHE CHARLY coming out of 17. Pins her dead to rights. Unconsc DAUGHTER cradled in her arms. Tiny DOLL cradled in the ki Charly runs, as the ground around her erupts like a  SHELLBURST. TIMOTHY, MEANWHILE, shouting into his walkie-talkie, sayi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her alive, Perkins wants her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey watches, helpless and PANICKED, as Charly tumble BACKWARD. Crashes through a CELLAR ACCESS, it splinters  beneath her...! Plunges into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits, cushions the kid. Grunt of PAIN... THE DARKNESS EXPLODES into kaleidoscopic FLASHES OF GUNFIRE, Charly st it all. The gas comes  bubbling out on burps and splatters, drenching the floor. Charly casts about for an escape route. Set into the bric wall, a huge steel DOOR. She flings it open -- MEAT LOCKE Nothing there, no help. Eyes darting. Possessed. A GRAVELY VOICE wafts down from above, then. Deadly serio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell gasoline, you have a little  accident...? I got plenty of matches  up here. Bad way for a kid to go.  Thirty seconds, think it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY stands in place, mind racing... Caitlin's DOLL. Re her dully. Plastic smile like it knows a secret. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MATCH FLARES as it descends into the bowl of a pipe... PERKINS puffs mightily. Turns and favors CHARLY and HENES with a thoughtful gaze, they're handcuffed to radiator... TIMOTHY straddles a nearby chair. Smiles and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to have you back again, Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Colonel, you ought really  to have stayed dead. You don't know  the rules of the game anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. Eight years ago, you send  me to kill Daedalus and this clown.  Now you're working *with* him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the fireplace, flips the match inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budget cuts, remember? Congress  blinded us in Eastern Europe, Central  America. Across the board, an  intelligence blackout. We had to  recruit any eyes and ears we could  find, even if it meant going to former  targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Suddenly Charly's eyes go wide. She whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budget cuts... oh, God. Is *that*  what this is about...? The foot  soldiers, the tanker truck... Fuck  me, you're running a fundraiser!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comprehension, dawning. She looks up in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get all the money you want at  the next budget hearing, won't you...?  All you need is a major terrorist  incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theory, my ass. I think some  terrorists were planning a strike.  Bought supplies from Daedalus, that's  how you knew they were coming... (eyes widening) No way. Don't tell me you're gonna  sit there and let them go through  with it, *just to get a budget  increase*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perkins shrugs philosophically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not without precedent. 1993,  remember the World Trade Center  bombing...? The CIA had advance  knowledge, don't think they didn't.  Worse, the diplomat who issued the  terrorist's visa was CIA, they  *facilitated* the bombing. Purely to  justify a budget increase. Of course,  they'd no way of knowing the  terrorists would botch the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna happen this time...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This time, the terrorist event  will come off precisely as planned.  This time the terrorists can't muck  it up... because we've killed them  and taken over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly and Henessey react, startled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the move. Our two heroes, shepherded across the compou Timothy's casualness is belied by the presence of two  dyspeptic GUARDS, each keeping a safe distance. A POCK-FACED AGENT approaches briskly, RIFLE across his  shoulder. Holds out his hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found these buried around the  perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy studies it: C-4 CHARGE with remote detonation uni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you get all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent rushes off. Timothy looks at Charly reproachful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, you give me the fuck of my  life then try to stick me, come back  from the dead, whack my boss... No  sense lyin', I'm miffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves like lightning. WHACK-! Kidney shot. Charly stumble vision going black. Fights for balance. Henessey starts t react but a GUN MUZZLE stops him. Charly straightens. Gri her teeth, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan? What's going out  in the tanker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy and the guards exchange looks. Cracking up, they  can't believe it -- Charly's not laughing. Looks at Timot with hooded, lifeless eyes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan? I'm gonna die, I  wanna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy lights a cigarette. Studies Charly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He casually points to the neighboring valley, where Chris lights twinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Claus -- small town U.S.A.  personified. We drive the chemical  tanker in tonight, park it. Add a  catalyst, chain reaction, it goes  hot. We evacuate. The mix heats  overnight, goes critical at 312  degrees Celsius. 8:00 Christmas  morning... Main Street looks like a  meteor strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking insane? You're talking  about 10,000 people!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Mitch. (to Timothy) How you gonna blame it on terrorists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those roads are treacherous this  time of year. When we dump a car to  the bottom of a ravine, with the  corpse of Imn Al Rahman in it... get  the picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Charly summons herself. Her voice a dull rasp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Timothy. Please. Let  my kid go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? For old times' sake...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you, *look at her eyes*...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why exactly should I do that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spits blood) Because they're yours, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares Timothy full in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night in Paris, I got pregnant.  The little girl's your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence. A pause... Then Timothy brays LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priceless. Can't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooting out loud. Tears, streaming... He manages to bring himself under control. Stops, gestures to the CELLAR ACCE the dark awaits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid's down there. What it is, Charly,  they're gonna find you both frozen  to death in the woods. Suicide pact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly fights to contain herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's no risk, Timothy, *let her  go*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freezer's downstairs, Charly.  Let's get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly and Henessey are separated at gunpoint. A look pas between them. Henessey swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait for you to rescue me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly goes through the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same CELLAR she occupied earlier. Timothy behind her, wrinkles his nose in distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, this place is loaded with fumes,  nobody light a fucking match. You  check her for flammables?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Checked her for colon cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin is sitting in a chair. Bundled in flannel, clutching her baby doll, the one Perk bought for her. She looks up at Charly dully. Sucking her thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh. Mommy's here, it's okay.  Safe and snug... what comes next,  huh...? What's the next part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bug in a rug... man with white  hair... says the same thing you say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly licks her lips. Easy, Charly, keep cool, she mustn die afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to take a nap together,  Cate. You can have your dolly, and  Mommy will be next to you, how's  that? It'll be like bears in winter.  When they get cold, see, they fall  deep, deep asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bears, yeah, yeah. Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the STEEL DOOR of the meat freezer. The guar opens it onto a gleaming silver CHAMBER. Timothy calmly  adjusts the thermostat. Sub zero. The guard reaches for  Caitlin's doll... Charly snatches it back. Face etched in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're murdering us both, cocksucker,  let the kid have her fucking dolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He subsides, unable to meet her gaze. At which point, Tim tosses her the WOODEN BOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, I'm not a total creep. I'll  make you a deal, okay? There's a  knife in that box. Now, you and the  kid, you're going to freeze, *but* --  if you kill the kid *by your own  hand*...? I won't kill your husband.  Serious. We're gonna open that door  and you'll both be frozen solid, but  I wanna know that you've cut your  own child's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to ever be on the receiving end of the LOO she gives him... Steps into the freezer, holding Caitlin. the door starts to swing shut, she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't over, motherfucker. You're  gonna die screaming and I'm gonna  watch. Am I telling the truth...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flashes him her most DAZZLING smile -- The whole room lights up. She can do that. As the door erases her from v a chill dances up Timothy's spine... because there was no resembling doubt on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY crosses with Caitlin to the far corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, it's cold in here-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Just for a little bit. Polar  bear, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves. Quick. Methodical. Breaks open the BOX: Sure enoug a hunting knife. Without missing a beat, she crosses to t STEEL DOOR. Kneels and begins DIGGING at the bottom edge. CARVING into the brick, what the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey, by the window. Tied to a chair. Timothy paces b him, carrying three razor-keen SCALPELS. Pegs one into th wall with deadly accuracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me where Charly keeps her money.  She must have mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get fucked, you dumb bastard. Charly  called Washington, by morning this  whole place'll be crawling with Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be gone by then, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that's what I'm saying,  there's a couple Feds, they couldn't  sleep, said they might come early.  Fuck you, someone'll screw up. Just  watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already did, Mitch, someone already  did. Perkins got stuck with a double  agent, someone trusted, highly placed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me. (chuckles) Chinks are paying me to bring down  Chapter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey reacts, startled. Timothy chuckles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck goes, hundreds dead -- rescue  teams within minutes, guess what  they find...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. They find Chapter, caught  with their pants down. See, Mitch, I  dumped in a much faster chemical  catalyst... (beat) The tanker's gonna blow *tonight*.  In the center of town, thirty-five  minutes from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY, sweating at sub zero. Brushes hair from her eyes. Blinks. Still jabbing with the knife, *why the hell is sh digging*? Gonna crawl under the damn door? She's gone loo Lying flat, she appraises her work -- A TINY NOTCH. Poked through to the other side. The actual penetration to daylight: millimeters. Then, she does two  seemingly nonsensical things: Crosses to Caitlin -- gentl takes the doll from her, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches in her mouth. Takes out her RETAINER. Must be the temperature. Crosses to the door again. Kneel down. Calmly, with infinite care, takes the retainer... Inverts it, now it's *trough*-shaped. Holds it flush agai the tiny NOTCH she carved. BABY DOLL, now. Holds it direc above the retainer. Depresses the KNOB in its back: It pees gasoline. Gas, trickling down the retainer, throu the brick -- into the other ROOM. Not much. Enough. She stands. DRAWS A TRAIL with the doll Crosses, dribbling, over to Caitlin. Hands the doll back her. What next..? She grabs the hunting knife, that's what. RAISES IT HIGH One terrifying moment, is she gonna put it in the kid...? Hardly. Brings it down on the floor. Slams it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a spark... show me, show me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries again. And again. STRIKING, over and over. Floor RI with the effort --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... do it...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in the end, it's just not gonna happen. *Won't work*. Lets go a GROAN of despair:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this, just one fucking match,  *Goddamit*...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She collapses forward. Cradles her head in frustration.  There's a tiny tap in her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly looks up, face haggard and depleted... Caitlin's e alive again. No longer dulled. Kid reaches inside her CAS and brings out a pack of matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry. I keep these here. (beat) For lighting your candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly stares, dumbstruck, at the tiny gift. The bitterness, the self-hatred, all of it. Under innocen eyes on Christmas Eve DETONATES, blown sky-high, and she  sweeps up her daughter and cradles her, tears streaming..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Caitlin, oh God, do you  know how much I love you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin pulls back, looks flush in her mother's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gonna die...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a dark and cold place, Caitlin has led her home. Cha eyes, like steel. A harsh whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, baby, you're not gonna die. They  are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strikes a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey, straining against his bonds. Sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly's stash. What's the number of  the locker, Mitch...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMOTHY across the room, a good forty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left nut, five bucks I make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, he raises a scalpel. Eyes dead like a rat's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame hovers above the gasoline trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I tell you, scream as loud as  you can, or else your ears'll get  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny nod. Charly calmly touches fire to the fuel. Cradl Caitlin to her chest, gently strokes her hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, should we buy a dog...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame races across the room. Hits the steel door. And zip! Vanishes through the NOTCH. A pause... THE BASEMENT BLOWS SKY-HIGH. Wooden walls, obliterated. Boards sheared. Atomized. THE  MEAT LOCKER DOOR blows inward like a cannon shot. Holds t its hinges, buckled like JIFFY POP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMOTHY'S THROW is off target, sticks in Henessey's chair Between his legs. Inches. Then the assassin LEAVES HIS FE look of comic surprise -- as the walls behind him disinte in FLAME. Henessey cries out, blinded as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's blown backward OUT THE WINDOW. Chair and all, loftin across the middle distance... blasts through the MOTEL SI Blows it to SPLINTERS. Tumbles, and over end... lands, WH Atop the garage's CORRUGATED ROOF. Chair flies to sticks. A BLUE SUIT spins, startled. Gun comes up -- Henessey doe miss a beat. Reaches between his legs. Plucks the KNIFE f the wood and slings it...! Guy takes it in the head, drop Some days you get lucky. He looks up in disbelief. FIREBALL, raging to Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You foxy bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMOTHY staggers from the smoke. Nicked and bloodied -- A Rushes into the cavernous GARAGE, where blue-suits scuttl like ants. Points to the tanker, face crazed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it out of here, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin in tow, SMOKE everywhere. Running flat out across the compound. Eyes ticking back and forth, missing nothin Sees a gun on the ground, scoops it up: promptly DROPS IT the fucking thing's red hot. That's when the POCK-FACED KILLER lurches out of the smok blade arcing for her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Run, Catey*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes under the blade. SLAMS him. Down they go, hit th dirt -- CAITLIN beats feet, vanishes into the smoke. Charly, fighting for her life. Manages to KICK FREE. He r up. Poised to hurl the KNIFE. Charly, dives, rolls -- sco up the gun and SCREAMS as her flesh sizzles and it spurts three times and blows him down. Doesn't stop. Rips the AUTOMATIC RIFLE from his shoulder. Rummages in his coat -- Cube of C-4. Even better. Casts a searching the smoke... No sign of her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAITLIN darts in and out of the trees. Frightened. In the background, men rush back and forth. The MOTEL burns merr Then, above the shouts, A RUMBLING noise, she darts a loo as THE TANKER comes trundling out of the garage. POV CAITLIN: Attached to the rear of the truck bed, a bri yellow UTILITY BOX, roughly three by three. As the driver idles, waiting for the road to clear -- Caitlin BREAKS CO Runs and climbs inside the box, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: Her mother. Crouched behind Timothy's RED JAGUAR. Scans  through the rifle's Starlight Scope. Sweating. Intense. W see the landscape, cast in ghostly GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you go, baby... show Mommy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *There*. Bingo. Charly watches through the scope as a TIN GREEN CAITLIN climbs into the box and shuts the lid.  Unfortunately, a nearby blue-suit has WITNESSED this. He  looks around, stabbing a finger at the box:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey, you see that? A little kid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet slams him backward in a cut-string sprawl.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: She lowers the rifle. Nods grimly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart girl, honey. Stay still. Don't  make a sound. Snug as a bug in a  rug...

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, ELSEWHERE ON THE GROUNDS
dialogues.text: HENESSEY, on the move. Crouched low. Choking on woodsmoke eyes streaming. Up ahead, a splayed CORPSE -- He hunkers  over the poor schmuck, guy's good for a radio. Snatches u the portable unit. Fumbles with the dial, searching for 2 megahertz...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY slews to a stop in the red Jag. Leaps out. Darts a the cliff, throws herself flat. Peering down at the groun sniper rifle positioned -- Babysitting the tanker. HEARS HENESSEY... Calling to her on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly, you there? Hello, Charly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabs the unit from her belt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch! I don't believe it. Listen,  if you say, "Are we having fun yet"  I'll rip your nuts off. Where are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the big garage. Is Caitlin  with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but she's safe for the moment,  she stowed away on the tanker truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey draws a sharp breath. Swallows, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly, Timothy rigged the tanker to  go off early. We got fifteen minutes.  No more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her reaction we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the tanker, A PANEL TRUCK sits, engine idling. Pho logo on its side -- *Little Debbie* snack cakes. A RAMP i lowered, and a CAR begins backing up into the truckbed, f outwards. INSIDE THE TRUCKBED, harried blue-suits hurriedly unwrap frost-covered corpse of IMN AL RAHMAN -- and place him be the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE, AT THE BACK OF THE TANKER
dialogues.text: A blue-suit puts a PADLOCK on the utility box as he passe SNAPS IT SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH HENESSEY
dialogues.text: He hears two flat CRACK-!s on the still air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...! Charly...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even over the receiver, her desperation's apparent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tires won't pop, Mitch. Bastard just  locked her in, she's stuck in there  and they're leaving, *Goddammit*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey rubs his eyes. Takes several deeps breaths, mind turning it over. He looks up. Tired. Haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll go in and get her,  you watch my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance. I make it twelve, Mitch,  automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So kill 'em for me, bitch, Christ,  what are you good for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stuffs a fresh clip in the gun. Wipes away sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) C'mon, buddy. Do one thing right,  just this once... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closes his eyes. Gathers himself. Long pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps from the roof and makes a death run. Gun in one hand, radio in the other. Swerving and dodging like a broken-field runner, CHARLY in his ear screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Your nine, on your nine*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins, BLASTS AWAY, dead guy, pitching forward -- SMOK billowing, making him COUGH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *30 degrees left, Mitch. Left*. (beat) *Your other left*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stumbling, catching himself. Barreling forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Nix, nix, I can't see in there,  don't do it, break right...*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Fuck me, I was wrong, get outta  threre*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He staggers out of the smoke: TWO MEN, MP-5 machine guns. Trained on his chest. He struggles to aim, oh, shit -- Tw distant CRACKS. The bad men go away, catapulted backwards Henessey shouts into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *De nada*.

dialogues.text: CHARLY fires shot after shot. Every time she squeezes the trigger, someone dies. No such thing as wounded, we're ta St. Peter looks up from a magazine and says holy shit, it the lunch rush at Kate Mantilini's.

dialogues.text: The smoke clears and Mitch sees the tanker. Right there,  thirty yards away. Yellow UTILITY BOX. No one in the way.

dialogues.text: *End run, Mitch, go wide*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *No, Goddamn you, they got you  flanked...*!

dialogues.text: Everybody fires a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Ma: I'm looking at the ants,  they're pretty great. Some really  funny ants here, Ma. All these funny  ants, think I'll stay and watch 'em  awhile...

dialogues.text: Aftermath... Charly's out of ammo. Flings aside the rifle snarling in a helpless rage -- Something else, then. SOUN nearby. Building in pitch, reaching a crescendo -- A SCREAMING CHOPPER RISES BEHIND HER. Crests the cliff and hovers like the SWORD OF DAMOCLES.

dialogues.text: MARKSMAN, riding shotgun. Scans the cliff below: Thick  evergreens. Charly, somewhere among them. He sights down rifle, takes careful aim -- BLOWS OUT TIRES on the Jaguar Cripples it. The chopper BANKS, heading away.

dialogues.text: In big trouble. MANY HEADLIGHTS, bouncing uphill toward h Cut off, they've cut her off -- The other direction ain't much better: A 200 FOOT DROP. Straight down. Evergreen tr far below. Power lines. Highway. She hears the PHONE RINGING, then... inside the Jag. Cros slowly. Reaches in, lifts the receiver. It's TIMOTHY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to give you a pretty death,  baby. Did my best. Now you're fucked,  now it's ground beef time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck. How long til it blows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Sweet Loretta, you're another animal  entirely. Let's see, 312 degrees...  Make it ten minutes, give or take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, spare me. You made a big noise  and bought five more minutes on the  planet. Give up. Die. I'll spit in  what's left of your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off. Charly drops the receiver. Turns, looks be They're coming for her. Woods filled with headlights. Backlit FIGURES. Ducking in and out of the trees, getting closer... The wind blows. B cold out here in the dark night of the soul. Nothing left No hope. No reason. Caitlin, dead. The rage explodes in the form of a kick which SHATTERS th lock on the trunk. *Dammit*, she needs a fucking miracle. At that moment, the trunk lid slowly rises, CREAKING...  Revealing all of Timothy's BUNJEE JUMPING EQUIPMENT.

dialogues.text: The TANKER is rolling. Out onto the road, snorting and  belching. Preceded by the Little Debbie PANEL TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor little Caitlin huddles in the dark. All alone. ROARI in her ears. Sort of like being underwater.

dialogues.text: A silver device attached to the skin of the tank.

dialogues.text: He consults a tiny, liquid crystal display on his watch. numerals. *178 degrees*.

Turns around -- Stands dead calm as they all come out of the TREES, guns  drawn... Raises her hands, see, boys...? No bang-bang. Like backlit monsters, they approach, hulking. Whipsaws out the door of the Jaguar, hooked by carabiner the STEERING COLUMN and meanwhile

dialogues.text: Rush forward, incredulous. Peer OVER THE EDGE: Below them swan diver, BLACKNESS all around. She drops like a stone. Vanishes into the fog, beautiful as a poem. dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: The Jaguar goes up with a solid CRUMP--! Blown off the ed of the cliff. Along with a half dozen screaming AGENTS.

dialogues.text: Lifeline cut. 60 feet above the road, no problem. She doe thirty feet in freefall. Raises her left hand -- Slaps a carabiner on a passing POWER LINE. Unhooks herself, turns as AN  ONCOMING CAR throws a fishtail SKID, just misses her. Dri SWEARS. She raises her gun. Fires without blinking. dialogues.text: Crosses to the car, face a stone mask. Behind her the FLA JAGUAR SMASHES to the ground, raining fragments -- Follow by BURNING CORPSES, smacking the pavement one after anoth She doesn't even look. Gets behind the wheel. Leaves most her tires on the road behind her.

dialogues.text: TIMOTHY barks orders into a mic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units converge. Divert local  law, this is a government matter.  Brook no interference, I want the  Baltimore woman eliminated. *Where's  the fucking chopper*?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes, she's with Santa Claus,  correct, er, excuse me, the individual  *playing* Santa, er... they're  pursuing the tanker truck, sir.

dialogues.text: Perkins stares straight ahead, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIDE BY SIDE WITH THE TANKER. Horses at full gallop, hoov in pounding frenzy. Charly tries to JUMP from one to the  other -- no go, the tanker pulls away, widening the dista and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RICOCHET whines off a hydraulic cable. Spurt of fluid a the BRAKES start to go, and meanwhile

dialogues.text: CHARLY throws herself flat next to Santa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. Government agents, high  level conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEDANS jockey for position, try to pull ABREAST -- Ch swerves the sleigh back and forth, won't let them through She hands the reigns to Santa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veer left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. In five seconds I'm gonna own  that fucking truck.

dialogues.text: Santa complies. PEELS OFF to the left -- Opens a TWELVE F chasm between sleigh and tanker. Sure enough, one of the  government cars spurts forward to fill the gap, comes ABR of them. It's what she wanted.

dialogues.text: Charly Baltimore LEAPS from the sleigh, lands atop the  government car. Skips lightly across it, casually BLOWS T SHOTS through the ROOF. Down through the metal. dialogues.speaker: THE CORPSE CAR
dialogues.text: Fades from the race, driverless. Whipping out of control. FISHTAILS away behind them -- Takes out the SECOND CHASE  CAR, spray of metal. Three seconds, and Charly's taken out two pursuers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door files open and the DRIVER sees CHARLY. Bloody.  Demonic. Wisely leaps out, BOUNCES from view -- Charly sn his hat as he goes by, plops it on her head. SWINGS UP in the drivers' seat, double-clutches -- pours on the steam. Five seconds. She owns the tanker. BLASTS forward into the lead PANEL TRUCK. Slams the truck from behind, BULLDOZES it -- Sends it THUNDERING into a p bench. Glass sprays. She owns the road. On the seat beside her: an MP-5 machin gun. She's set. Throws a NINETY DEGREE turn onto a sidest Donates most of her tires to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly's on fire. Senses heightened. Eyes tick back and f like a machine. Heading downhill, out of town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Catey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits the brakes. A flash of SPARKS..! A ripping WHINE dies away -- The brake pedal is all play. Nothing. She's a runaway truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *No, not fair, not fucking fair...*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barreling onward. A lunging behemoth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stop, Catey, can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAIN-LINK FENCE, at road's end. Beyond it, a quarter-mil plunge. Downhill over rocky terrain -- To St. PETER'S SEMINARY. Looming stone structure. Closed  now. Vast empty PARKING LOT. Tears on her cheeks. Lights a cigarette. Takes a long dra exhales:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my dick, every one of you  bastards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blows through the chain-link fence. SHUDDERS AND LEAPS DOWNHILL. Mud blows skyward. Trees, bl to splinters.

dialogues.text: Buffeted inside the UTILITY BOX. Cries out as

dialogues.text: And all the windows BLOW OUT concussively and the front t go with a volcano CRACK-! as the beast goes canting to on side, ponderous, MASSIVE... It keels over on its side. Still doing fifty. TRAVERSES THE PARKING LOT. Slows itself by TAKING OUT LIGHT POLES, shears them off l saplings. Whacks the side of the chapel. IMPACT. Keeps going... Charly is EJECTED from the cab. Pinwheels through space l a broken doll, bursts through a STAINED GLASS WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass ruptures as she catapults through. Hits on her  stomach, bounces. Slides to a stop, rolls over -- FLINGS herself aside just in time, as a towering ST. PETE SMASHES to earth an inch from her head, showers marble... Concussion dies away. Silence. Echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanker slides, DETONATING planters one by one... Come to rest in a central COURTYARD. Lies there, a hissing  dinosaur. TIMOTHY'S TEMPERATURE GAUGE is still affixed to the truck underbelly: *280 degrees*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly, semi-conscious. Rolls onto her back, gasping. Sta at the gathered saints. Swallows hard. Sucking it up,  preparing. Rolls to one knee, plants her foot... She's got to make that truck. On her feet now. Stumbling forward. One arm hugging her g Cross-eyed, so hard to focus... left foot, right foot, ge it done, bitch, yes it's *supposed* to hurt that much, fl open the door and she's so brave that for a second we thi she might make it. Timothy kicks her in the head. Charly flies back. Hits and SLIDES. Fetches up against a  bannister, WHAM--! Timothy calmly shuts the door behind h Consults his tiny gauge -- *297 degrees*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it four minutes to detonation.  I got a chopper on the way, lots of  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sheds his coat. Stows his gun. Removes a SWITCHBLADE.  Drapes the coat on the bannister. Flicks open the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey. Only four inches...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll feel me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches, almost casually. Charly staggers erect. Ad a killing stance. Instinct. She can barely stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERKINS hears a garbled, pained voice over his headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point team leader, reporting...  She's... incapacitated the truck...  I'm damaged, sir, I believe I'm  dying... Instructions...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue dying. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back. Stares sightlessly. Loosens his tie, hits intercom and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, get me the President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a bottle of Scotch. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly and Timothy. They circle, two pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lost a step, Chuck. Muscles  never recovered from C-section, I'll  bet. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never watching the eyes, the eyes are liars, they watch t HANDS... The gathered saints look on, neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, man... She's only... eight...  she's a beautiful little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His concentration never falters as he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a worthless bitch. I know it  'cause she came out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LUNGES with the knife, she spins away -- He gets hold one arm and FLINGS her, up and over...! She SAILS through space. Twists in mid-air. Lands like a cat. Almost. Stagg forward. They circle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called shock, Charly... Your  body wants to go into shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, your breathing's lousy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly LAUNCHES herself. Avoids a stab at her throat, eat that for breakfast, spins, slams the knuckles of her righ hand into Timothy's ribs. Busts one. He snarls, TRAPS her wrist: CRACK! Wrist, broken. She HISSES in pain, falls ba GASPING. Circling again. Charly cannot walk a straight line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. You're out of your  motherfucking league, dearie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLY
dialogues.text: She looks up at him from sunken eyes shot through with re and in those eyes we glimpse it; the DEMON, laughing... a Charly whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You want a piece...? Take my  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges with the knife...! She ducks, trips on purpose HANDS HIM HER SHOULDER, all that's missing is the plate - And WHAM. In goes the knife, cuts deep and Charly looks h in the eye and GRINS because sure enough, there's the  bastard's KNEE, wide open... Boot-strikes, BAM--! Shears the knee, and Timothy HOWLS i agony. Stumbles backward into the bannister -- Grabs his coat. Brings out the gun, it GOES OFF--! Charly dives for cover. Rips the knife from her own shoul and flings it. Takes him in the shoulder. Topples him back. BANNISTER. U and over, flailing...! Drops from sight. Charly falls back. Pause. Sucking air. Sits down hard. Le splayed. Looks down at herself, oh, God... There's a hole in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors burst open and here she comes. Trauma, severe.  Shock, blood loss -- She makes for the tanker. For her ki Hitches. Staggers. Going on sheer guts.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER ROARS OVERHEAD
dialogues.text: The PILOT brandishes his radio mic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got her. Heading for the tanker,  thirty yards out. She's all over the  place, something's wrong with her.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: Left foot, right foot, she's not running, she's falling i straight line -- Reaches the tanker. Staggers against the inverted chassis. UTILITY BOX. Above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Cover your ears*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her gun. Fires. BAM-! Lock springs to pieces.  CAITLIN tumbles to the pavement, dazed and confused. Cast about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMMY...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She springs to her feet. Comes running and flings both ar around her mother. HUGS HER -- That one puts Charly out f a few seconds. PAIN, excruciating. Comes to her senses,  swaying like a clothesline in a high wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run... get out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go away again, Please...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly grabs Caitlin's head. Turns it. Facing the TEMPERA GAUGE. Red numerals: *301 degrees*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's a bomb... gonna blow up,  RUN... I'm right behind you, go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin hovers, torn. Charly summons a gutteral CROAK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...*Go and don't look back*...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the end, Caitlin relents. RUNS, toward the surrounding woods... Charly watches her go. Nods, satisfied -- Collap Hits the tarmac and splays in a heap. Breath wheezing in out. Already the pavement is staining red.

dialogues.speaker: WITH CAITLIN
dialogues.text: As, within ten seconds of the command, she promptly DISOB her mother, looks back -- Stops dead. There's a corpse underneath the truck. It isn't moving. It isn't breathing. It isn't laughing or crying... Or hurting, not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Mommy, no...*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb forgotten. Danger forgotten. Her tiny arms pumping,  feet slapping pavement -- She returns to her mother. Grab one knife-bloodied shoulder, oblivious of the wound. Jerk back and forth. Frenzied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm sorry I left, please  wake up, come on please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLY. Cheek against the pavement. One lifeless eye STAR Bloodshot and sightless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government vehicles, pulling up now. At the edge of the  parking lot. 100 yards away, give or take. Numerous SEDAN The Little Debbie panel truck. AGENTS crouch behind cars. Weapons trained on the wounded behemoth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side door BURSTS OUTWARD and a limping figure emerges frantically signaling for the chopper: TIMOTHY'S got murd in his eye. THE CHOPPER banks, coming in low as he hauls  himself aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, your shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the shoulder, knee's worse.  Just bring me around and hold her  steady. I'm not leaving until I know  the bitch is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs an automatic rifle.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CAITLIN
dialogues.text: She adheres to Charly's motionless form. Looking small an terrified. Whispers in her mother's ear. Soft and low:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, get up now. You just stop it,  Mommy, you stop being a little baby.  Stop it, you're not dead, I know  you're not dead so you get up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face contorted, she strikes out. Flails. HITS Charly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Don't you die*, you get up now,  Goddammit...! Life is pain, you just  get used to it, and stand up *right  this minute*, Mommy. Life is pain,  do it, you bitch. *Do it*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears coursing in rivulets. Little fists clenched. Then - It might be a trick of the wind. Tiny aspiration, not eno breath to fog a mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...mommy... here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A solitary tear appears in the wide-open staring eye. One fingernail, then. Scratches feebly. Toes, shifting. Seeki purchase. A HAND, planting itself... TEETH BARED, a rictu of pain... Rising up... *Standing*. Full height now, flexing one deadly arm. She  hugs her daughter and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're grounded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, the HOWLING of rotor blades. Charly gasps for  breath. Cracks open the GUN... no bullets. Swell. Scans t pavement... There. THE MP-5 machine gun lies twenty feet  from her. Twenty miles, same difference. Across the pavem even farther away: Timothy's car. *305 degrees*. Charly swallows hard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get the gun, you run for  that car. We go on three, okay? One...  Two... *Three*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break cover. Into the open. A WITHERING FIRE ERUPTS. Right at their feet...! Geysers of asphalt, shot skyward TIMOTHY sprays the blacktop from above. Ruthless. Charly  goes insane. Lurches, crazed, to the cab of the truck. Th the mike and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody get that motherfucker off  me! I got a kid here, I got my eight  year-old daughter, *Jesus Christ*...!  It's Christmas Eve, who are you  *people*, fucking pull him off! Do  you hear me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYES SNAP OPEN IN DARKNESS. We don't know whose they are. don't know where we are.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CHARLY
dialogues.text: The temperature gauge: *308 degrees*. She clutches Caitli Shouting into the mic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distract him, for God's sake give me  ten seconds, please, I'm begging  somebody, anybody, *she's my  daughter*...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sour-looking CHAPTER AGENT stands before a row of cars the Little Debbie panel truck. Expressionless beaurocrat. Lifts the mic to his lips and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, ma'am, we understand your  request, but we've decided to go  ahead and let this play out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the back of the panel truck EXPLODES. A car  CATAPULTS outward into space -- SMASHES DOWN atop two sed Blows out their windshields. Flings itself to the pavemen and RICOCHETS forward, zero to sixty.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH HENESSEY
dialogues.text: At the wheel. Making a suicide run. Face a FRIGHT MASK of deadly purpose. We have no idea why someone who looks lik him is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Distraction*, just enough: The pilot banks toward the CA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are *you* going??

dialogues.text: Timothy grabs the stick -- THAT'S WHEN CHARLY BREAKS COVE Does a MAD STAGGER across the blacktop. Goes for the GUN. TIMOTHY CHANGES DIRECTION. Chopper again, SCREAMING in lo and fast -- CHARLY dives, rolls -- Comes up with the MACHINE GUN and  falls flat on her back, points it skyward:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires. Blows the chopper's TAIL ROTOR. The craft pitc to the side -- Dumps Timothy out the door. Flailing. Head over heels, he FALLS -- Lands atop the TANKER, right the silver tank and *burns*. Actually SIZZLES at 310 degr Celsius, steam pouring off him like a vampire in daylight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die screaming, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as he slips from sight... off the tanker. SIR now, approaching. Wind, biting cold. Ground black and blo in the moonlight... HERE COMES HENESSEY, powers across the lot, pedal to the  metal. Followed at a distance of fifty yards by half a do squawling GOVERNMENT VEHICLES, flashers turning. Henessey stomps the brake. SLEWS to a stop, tires cooking KICKS open the passenger door as Charly collapses into th car, CAITLIN in her arms. The kid says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! The truck is a bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. What else, we got a  fucking lightning rod on the roof...?  No, Caitlin, *don't check*.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PEELS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... you're bleeding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inadvertently smacks a light pole. SPARKS fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *You're a bad driver! Who said you  could drive*?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to drag Timothy inside the car. The engine ROAR as it leaps forward, trailing the other FIVE -- Scarred a hideous, he stares after Charly, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *Somebody do her, somebody kill that  fucking whore, kill her*!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the helicopter crashes. The pilot does everyt but flap his arms -- Forget it. IT KEELS OVER. Rotor touc pavement -- Blows to pieces. They ALL go. Snapped off. Bl like rockets in every direction. TIMOTHY LOOKS UP as a rotor blade whistles right through windshield of his car. Shears off his HEAD. Blows out the BACK in a shower of glass and hurtles onward, SPINNING ou of control... Strikes the tanker. Boom. Imagine God in Monte Carlo. Tossing dice the length of a  craps table. Now, imagine the dice are BURNING CARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey flies out of the parking lot and INTO the WOODS the firestorm RAGES TO HEAVEN behind him. Cars, heading h way -- AIRBORNE. Fights the wheel, swerving through the w as all around him, FLAMING CARS crash down. BOUNCING into and out of the trees, peekaboo... Some go flying past OVERHEAD. Striking in front like mete GOUGING the earth. Caitlin screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hit the cars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey favors her with a foul look. CHARLY looks up and sees ANGELS flying overhead, trailing concrete... Then they're OUT OF THE WOODS. Car slingshots onto the hi and races forward, SAFE. Behind it, the sky is aglow, SNO fiery traces... Bits of earth, trees, pavement. OVERHEAD VIEW: As they roar out of town, we see burning w and a CRATER approximately 150 yards in diameter -- St.  Peter's Seminary no longer exists... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey coasts to the side of the road and stops. He lay his head on the steering wheel, sucking air. Looks at Cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, can't drive... Are you okay...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimaces) ...Are you... stupid...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...funny thing...? You aren't going  to die... I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly offers him that soft, sad little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey starts to fade... breathing labored... Reaches u strokes Caitlin's hair. Smiles at her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, gorgeous... know something...  you got your mother's eyes... don't  let... nobody tell you different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slumps back in the seat. Gazing at Charly. A single tear  runs from one bloodshot eye. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared... to be nobody... without a  ripple... please... remember me... (beat) ...Love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dies. Charly leans on the dash. Cries for awhile. For herself.. for Henessey... for this Godawful planet, and everything  else. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER SITS in the glow of a Winnie the Pooh nightlight Next to her sleeping daughter's bed -- back to the very  beginning of the film, it's been a long kiss goodnight. An elderly FARMER pokes his head in. She doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Ma'am...? Ambulance is here.  They'll be right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadowy figure nods... Remains seated. Stays awhile i the dark. Keeping vigil. Snow slithers against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. PERKINS emerges from a guest cottage, flanked by his  aide Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They'll push for dismantlement of  our apparatus in Chile, but we've  got a degree of plausible  deniability...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's FOOT comes down on a circular slab of STONE -- an voice from the grave says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops him in his tracks, stops him dead -- As CHARLY BALTIMORE steps from the nearby trees. Stands,  twenty yards downrange. Beretta leveled at both of them. Two months, you barely notice the limp. She stands there sleeveless top and short skirt and looks like a million.  Thumbs a metal box, click-! A red ARMING LIGHT blinks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, I'm Charly. The slab  you're standing on is actually a  land mine. Keep your foot on the  pressure plate, nothing happens.  Step off the stone, we'll all be  wearing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERKINS steps forward. The gun shifts. Targets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charly, I know we've treated you  poorly, please, it was just business --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches in a pocket. Tosses him a cellular phone -- H catches it as though it were a live snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My terms are these. Call State and  order full disclosure on your personal  correspondence. Then disband Chapter,  effective immediately. In exchange...?  I won't shoot you, and I won't make  you stand on that mine. I won't touch  you. I won't touch you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows hard. Looks to his aide... back to her... DIA Charly takes a deep breath. Scans the flowers, face placi It's really quite lovely today. Maybe she'll start a gard Perkins clicks off. Look at Charly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. Now, you promise... you  won't shoot me... won't make me get  on the mine...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. Shifts her aim and shoots the other guy. Perkins' eyes WIDEN in sudden realization. He LUNGES forw grabs the aide, holding him up... desperately propping hi dead weight atop the land mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you, I can't hold him... You  bitch... YOU FUCKING BITCH...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey's CHRYSLER CONVERTIBLE has been restored to a ch red. It purrs along the boulevard, Charly at the wheel. H blowing. She talks on the cellular phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. President, you have my  assurance that Perkins' latest  operation has been rendered beyond  salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her a GOUT OF EARTH blows skyward. Showers the roa ways back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in the greatest shape either.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
dialogues.text: He speaks from the oval office, face grave:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you an astounding debt of  thanks, Colonel. Would it be  impertinent to ask if you'd consider  working for State again? The moneys  involved would be substantial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the question. I've got a stack  of papers to grade. Listen, before I  go, I need a small favor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henessey's EX-WIFE stands in the open doorway, flanked by her son TODD. Two uniformed COPS speak solemnly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As I say, we can only apologize  for the system, Ma'am, but it's  confirmed that your husband is  innocent of the crime for which he  was imprisoned. This is a photograph  of the actual criminal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows her a mug shot of TIMOTHY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A petty thief, now deceased. I'll  respect your wishes should you choose  to file charges against the State  Attorney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the eyes of a young boy, Henessey finds redemption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun, passing into mystery. Wheatfield, rippling. Caitlin in the yard, chasing a big floppy-eared Labrador. On the porch, a CRICKET chirps. HAL comes out, sits besid his wife CHARLY as she finishes eating. Says softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just talked to Dr. Sullivan, she's  gonna need the full braces. Even  with your teaching, insurance won't  cover it... I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Charly says nothing. The dog parades up to Caitlin with a stick in its jaws. A farm truck goes by, a faraway speck. Charly absent-mindedly rolls a steak knife in her fingers Eyes far away. It never occurs to her what she's done until the chirping stops. Ten feet away, the knife quivers. FADE OUT.
